review: This location of Red Robin recently opened and has been packed ever since. The wait staff is friendly and the food will satisfy your summer craving for burgers, salads, shakes, etc. Bar area is pretty big and they have some specials 8pm-11pm.

We've eaten had Red Robin at other locations over the years and was happy to see one open up in the PTC shopping center. After hitting the movies today, we decided to stop in and give this location a try. We arrived a little before 4pm on a Sunday afternoon, so it was't busy and we were seated immediately. At first I was quite happy to see a digital tablet (Ziosk system) sitting on our table as being a geek, I was hoping to be able to place my order and pay for it through this system. Sadly, you can only place orders for drinks, appetizers, and desserts. You can pay your bill with it and you can control what song plays in the restaurant ($0.99/song) or you can play any of the games that the system offers for $1.99 (unlimited game play).  On the menu are various kinds of burgers, but you'll also find some chicken sandwiches, wraps, and salads. My wife went with their Whiskey burger, which is what she typically gets and she said it was as good as usual. I went with the California chicken sandwich sans the bun and cheese. I'm sure it would have tasted better on the bun and with the cheese, but it was OK as is. I do wish the bacon was much crisper. The kids had the grilled cheese and chicken fingers. You have a selection of side choices--my wife and kids took the steak fries and I went with the side salad. The side salad is basically iceberg lettuce with chopped tomatoes, cucumbers, and croutons. The "all you can eat" steak fries are wedge like cut fries and just not my thing. Service was good throughout our meal. When we were done, I simply clicked the Pay Bill on the Ziosk system, swiped my credit card, entered the tip amount, signed on-screen, had my receipt emailed to me, and I was on my way. I really liked this as you don't have to wait for your waitress and this can be very helpful when you have kids with you that are ready to go!  All in all, a good burger place and we are happy that one has opened up nearby. We'll be back!

Not one for chains, but this opened like 2 miles from my house and I do love burgers.  I have to say it was an overall good experience.  I was particularly enthralled by the tablet on the table that lets you get a better look at bar drinks and food, play music and even pay right there.   Staff was beyond friendly and I'm very intrigued by their late night happy hour specials.   Good burgers, friendly service, incredible prices, and right down the street.  I'll call it a local win.

Great service and super friendly staff.  Food was typical chain restaurant quality but the bottomless fries make up for that.  Pretty cool decor inside that makes it be a place people will want to hang out at.  I also love being able order stuff and pay right at your table with the Ziosk system.  Nice addition to the Town Center.  I'll definitely be frequenting this place.

3 stars for Red Robin, based on my most recent burger and shake experience. This is a new addition in the providence town center at collegeville, which is basically a huge outdoor food court with a few retail places nearby.  Seriously, there are almost as many places to eat\drink as there are to shop here!   Its a nice, new restaurant with a friendly staff and eclectic decor.  Old school pictures on the wall with a K-Pax movie poster.  Interesting for sure!  I was greeted by an enthusiastic and friendly hostess, who kindly asked if I'd prefer sitting at a booth or in the bar area...altho there are TVs everywhere, I decided to sit in the bar area.  You really can't turn around in here without seeing a TV including a nice big screen TV behind the bar...as others have mentioned, they also have little tablets on each table where you can play games, send songs to the jukebox, and even order drinks and dessert...in addition to paying your bill...pretty clever, not sure how these things will hold up once some kid gets his hands on it...or his marinara sauce...but I like seeing how businesses are embracing this newer tablet technology... All seems lovely so far...and indeed it is, but now its time for food...This is a "gourmet" burger place.  Which basically means they have a bunch of what they consider "gourmet" burger\topping combinations on the menu...not like cheeburger cheeburger where you order a burger, then pick what toppings you like, creating your own gourmet burger...altho you certainly can do that here...I think this is a corporate thing so they can say "we have this many burgers on our menu", even tho most of them are pretty much the same with a couple toppings switched around...Personally I don't like anyone suggesting what I get on my burger, I can pick my own toppings thanks!   I went with the Bacon Cheeseburger with American...They have several cheeses available(big plus), and I was pleased to be asked "how do you want that done?"   which is one of my favorite questions when dining out...I went with Medium... So, it comes out and its about 4 inches tall...but about 1.5 inches of that is lettuce and another 2 inches bun, leaving a fairly thin patty to make up the last .5 inches...not exactly the big burger I was expecting.  The "big" burger, according to my server, is 6 oz and the "petite" is 3oz...I got the big one but didn't think it was so big compared to the amount of lettuce on there...It was cooked as ordered and smelled delicious, but I wasn't overly "wowed" by it...in fact, it was very average to me and I didn't even finish it...It was incredibly greasy, my bun practically turned to mush from the greasy burger making it a bit of a mess to eat...at 9.99, I hardly consider it a bargain, even with the "endless fries".  One nice thing is you can substitute a few items for the fries free, and some other items cost 49 cents, which isn't too bad considering a lot of places charge a dollar to make substitutions or don't allow it at all. Move onto the shake...they have vanilla soft serve that they mix with flavors to get a variety of shakes.  Meh...give me some hand scooped chocolate ice cream please!  That chocolate syrup just doesn't do the trick!  I got a chocolate banana...they don't even use a real banana, but a prepared banana puree they add in for flavoring...the banana was spot on, but the chocolate syrup was quite simply lacking real chocolate flavor. They do have a full bar, and I understand they have some good specials at night...so this could be a fun place to have some bar food and watch a game...but as far as "gourmet burgers" are concerned, I'll pass...

This is one of the newer locations (just opened in July 2013)  with a more upscale look then older restaurants. Since it's new, I'll give them a break on the wait staff. The waiter gave me the wrong drink initially, but replaced it with the correct one later. He never did ask if we wanted refills of our drinks or "endless fries". The new bottomless french fry holder is kinda cute, but not as practical as those little plastic baskets the burgers & fries use to come in.  Food as is good as you can expect. My favorites are the Whiskey River burgers and chicken sandwiches.  I'll go back because I like their menu and selection. Hopefully the service improves as the staff get better trained.

Nice, clean, and packed.  That is a good way to start a review I guess.  The selection of burgers are good, but there is mayo on everything. GROSS! Ok, you can get it ordered to your liking though, but by my experience, be prepared to send it back and wait another 20 minutes on your food.  The food quality is good and the servers are pretty attentive, minus getting the order completely wrong, but from my former experience in the restaurant industry; it is typically the kitchen not the server that gets these special orders mixed up.  The bottomless fries advertisement  is misleading though. I think they literately mean "bottomless fries" as in there is no bottom to the fry container..... :/ I'll live though as the proportions are satisfying.  It is a little pricey though for what you are getting, but in the end it's a decent burger joint. Be prepared to spend $40-50 for two with an adult beverage.  I would return in the future for a second go as I love me a good burger.

Great burger joint especially for families with kids.  Our server, Ben, was attentive and he consistently anticipated our needs.  Drink refills and food delivery were quick! Food was good.  Love the tablet at the table which allows you to order and pay at the table. You can also pay ($2) for apps for the kids to play games at the table.

I took my grandson, daughter and wife this evening. The restaurant was not at all full but the service was horrific. It took them atleast ten minutes after seating before the server acknowledged us and tuned on the automatic ordering gizmo on the table. I know why they have them....it is about the only way you get any service or your bill.  The food order was simple but it took at least 20 minutes. The server did stop and apologize but try and comfort a hungry 3 year old.  The meals were all good but nothing that really stood out...it is a chain after all.   As we left, the servers were all huddled around the host station talking.  There are way too many good chains to give this place a second look.

My co-worker and I wanted to to try the Ava-Cobb-o salad. We took it as take out. It was disgusting. The lettuce was brown, brown to the point that if it was in my fridge I'd trash it. There were hardly any toppings. It just wasn't enjoyable and I'll never eat their salads again.  My co-worker also got the Baked Potato Soup and she said it was very bland. She would not get this again either.  We both ended up throwing away our $10 salads halfway through finishing them. Very poor quality.  On a better note, their burgers and fries are good. I'm also Gluten Free so the fact that they carry gluten free buns is something I always love restaurants taking the initiative to do.  Just stick with the burgers and fries at this place...

No complaints here. I've been here twice and there hasn't been any opening day jitters yet. I have never been to a Red Robin before, so maybe it's just my inexperience, but the burgers are pretty small. You can add an extra patty for a nominal fee, so problem solved. I started off with the appetizer wedge salad, which was like every other wedge salad I've ever tried. I'm a big fan and I suppose it's a hard dish to mess up. It was good. I had a Banzai burger, extra patty, wrapped in lettuce as my entree. It was exceptional. The meat was perfectly pink in the middle. The combination of the mayo, tomatoes, and pineapple was strange but very flavorful. It was one of those meals that you found yourself wishing you could eat more of hours later.  I have to say the service was a touch slow but I've had far worse elsewhere. I will definitely come back again.
I love Red Robin but if the employees don't know how to clear dishes & let them clutter up this place is gonna fall apart & so will their tips.
Consistently good. Been here four times and get a burger each time. I am fond of the "Burnin' Love". The fries are always hot. The servers are overly accommodating which is nice from a big chain.

Before this location opened, I rode my bike to Lionville two or three times a year just to go to the Red Robin there.   (Actually, 113 wasn't bad until they put that chip crap on the shoulders.)  Needless to say I was ecstatic when the location at 29 and 422 opened.  I know a back way I can use to get there too. They have a unique selection of burgers.  I don't remember the names for all of them but my favorite so far is the Whiskey River BBQ Burger.  I like the endless fries concept, but actually they don't give you many for your initial serving, so of course you're going to ask for more.  If you would rather have a veggie burger, they can do that for you as well.  I haven't tried their desserts yet, usually because I'm too full from the burgers.  I agree their service is a little slower than most, but at this point I won't let that stop me from going back. I'm not a big fan of the table-top Ziosks though.  You have to pay if you want to hear music or play games--really?  Last time I was there they had the payment app turned off; I don't know if it's just a bug or if they realize something's wrong.  I would also prefer a stand-alone location, but a Red Robin is a Red Robin and at last, the Collegeville area has one.  You can eat and shop on the same trip if you want. As high-priced as nearby Elevation Burger is, you can walk a few stores down Plaza Drive to Red Robin and get more bang for your buck.

I have been to  this restaurant twice and was not impressed.  too bad because it so close to my home.  Yesterday I had  a late lunch with three of my friends and all of us had complaints.  All the waitress did was apologize.  Three of us had burgers, one had a chicken sandwich which she liked.  i asked for my burger to be pink, it was well done and had little taste;  It was one of their gourmet burgers.  all that had french fries said they were cold, one had coffee that she said was boiled.  The waitress had too many tables, and could not handle them.  You'd think a restaurant would welcome people that come to eat at 2pm.  We will not return.  There are many restaurants in the collegeville area to choose from.

This place was like is stepped into wonderland. Everyone here was like a ray of sunshine. This is really how service should be. Even the girl clearing plates said "enjoy the rest of your dinner guys"  And I have a new favorite burger- the chophouse. It had onion straws, cheese and (wait for it) horseradish marinated sautéed mushrooms. It was ah-maz-ing.  For years coming here, I always got the whiskey river burger and even when they took it off the menu, I always asked them to make it for me.

I only eat the burgers so I can't speak to the quality of the other dishes offered. As for the burgers they are excellent: always cooked to perfection, quality meat, and very flavorful. On this recent trip the whiskey BBQ caught my attention. Once this magnificent plate of meat arrived the smell of smoked whiskey BBQ hit my nose. I dove in and this burger met every expectation I had. In the future I will get the burger without the extra toppings. Aside from the burgers being great the service here runs like a well oiled machine and everyone is always friendly and efficient. Chain be dammed this place nails it!

Red robin ... YUK Where to start ? Drinks took almost 15 minutes to finally get to the table, another 10 minutes  we placed our order two soups as an app n two burgers,  I guess 25 minutes later the burgers came out I said to the waitress I guess we r not getting the soups her response  no they r coming, my response was the purpose of an app was to get them first.  The soup was taken of the bill however the manager never came to the table.  The place was busy I get it I've been in the food business for over 20 years but the manager should have at least stopped at the table.  The food  was average at best  we could have gotten better food n service at Wendy's....
We went with a group unplanned; they did a fair job trying to get everyone seated. Waitress was great and friendly, love the new tablet's for ordering and call the sever.

Oh yeah... gourmet burgers, limitless fries,  OUTSTANDING SERVICE, and a dozen big-screen TVs all tuned to sports.... what's not to love?  Maybe the only chain-franchise that my wife & I both agree is top-notch.  Kudos to the management there.  The knuckleheads who cannot run nearby Firebirds should come by for lunch and take copious notes.  They suck at Management 101;  you all rule!
I really like the red white and blue salad and the mixed drinks are good as well.The staff is always nice and friendly.My son loves the milkshakes.
amazing burgers and sandwiches!! not badly priced. great restaurant if you aren't sure what you want. definitely go to red robin.

Speaking in very general terms -- I'm a fan of Red Robin.  And I've been to probably half a doze different ones over the past few years.  Most of them are easy 4 or 5 stars without thinking about it.  If I could give half stars, I'd give this one a 3.5... here's why... We came in to the restaurant and had to wait -- not terribly unusual for a Red Robin. Except, in this one, there is nowhere to sit and wait... we had to stand for about 15 minutes.  Again, the length of wait is not a big deal...  it's more the fact that we had to stand. Most Red Robin restaurants are open and airy.  This one felt cramped, crowded and very narrow in its design.  Once seated the waitress was attentive enough, took our orders and all that good stuff fairly quickly.  It was super-loud, even by Red Robin standards -- but our food came quickly.  Unfortunately, it wasn't quite up to the RR standards.  My chophouse burger was undercooked and my son's mac and cheese looked like it just came out of the microwave.  I mean, I get it, you did put it in the microwave... but take 5 seconds and stir it up for goodness sakes... Otherwise, it's a pretty typical RR...

Red Robin is the epitome of "average" as far as chain restaurants go ranked somewhere between Friendly's and Applebys. They do have a few little touches that make them unique; the tabletop tablet device lets you order food and pay for your meal ($2 for Android games??? Really??) and a dizzying array of burgers and sandwiches being the biggest draw. Other than that it's really nothing special and is actually a poor choice given other options in the area. The burgers, their "claim to fame", are rather... gosh... average. I tried the Black & Blue burger, a $15 burger, and it really was mediocre at best. Way overpriced for a fairly unmemorable sandwich. My wife had the Tavern Burger which was basically a sad looking Big Mac type thing. Nothing was bad but it was all far from great. The real killer for me is how average the food was and how premium some of the prices are. There's better food in the same shopping center and for the cost I'd rather have dined at PF Chang's. Given that Elevation Burger is basically right next door and Max & Erma's is right down the street I seriously.  recommend giving Red Robins a pass and head to one of the better options to satisfy your craving for a burger.

The food when we got it was really good. If you haven't tried the colossus burger it's worth it!! Service this trip was subpar and the bar service was really slow. Not bad enough that I wouldn't go back just annoying.

I eat here almost every Friday with my husband and parents. Obviously since we keep coming back, we are big fans. The burgers, wraps, salads, milkshakes and appetizers are delicious, there are free refills on fries and some other sides, and the service is usually on point. We have had a few experiences where the food took a long time or was incorrect. However, when we did have a poor experience they have good customer service and have done whatever they could to make us happy, which I really appreciate.

Sorry, the burgers we had were nothing special, but the fries and onion rings were a bit better than average, And it may just be the night we visited, but there were a lot of loud customers and screaming children, which contributed to a negative experience. And I find the Ziosk tablet on the table to be very downscale and at odds with the concept of waiter service.
The burgers are pretty good. I had the Big Sky burger tonight which had a lot of flavor. I also like the onion rings and my kids love the milkshakes.

We've visited this restaurant several times since it opened. The food is classic burgers-and-fries fare, with many variations on the burger and the types of foods that sit-down places at this level offer (salads, soup, etc.). Generally, the food is good, though not special. The dining room is clean, with a casual decor. The downfall here is the service. Servers, when you can find them, are friendly but actual service is often rather slow. It doesn't mean much to offer "bottomless fries" if your server visits very infrequently. Our most recent experience waiting for our order tested our patience to the point that one of us was very nearly ready to walk out.

Been here twice, both times had cold food. Second time it took forever to get the food and it was still cold and incorrect. Had to wait an extra 10 minutes for warm fries. Not once did a manager stop by to apologize or even as ask about our experience.

It's a chain, so I judge it as that.  We go here about once a month.  Great appetizers, I especially love the warm pretzels bites with beer cheese sauce.  Good potato soup.  Yummy shakes.  Great burger with tons of options.  Love the fries, but I'm usually too full for the free refill.  Good fried fish filet.  I have typically experienced friendly and fast service.  Love that you can pay the bill at the table without asking for the check with the Ziosk.  Feels safer to never have the card taken away from the table.  Overall, good food and service.  I like this place better than most chains.

I've been to Red Robins on several occasions and I've always had a great meal. Service can be hit or miss but other than that, the food is great and the atmosphere is pretty relaxed.  I mostly order burgers when I'm here and I highly recommend the Guacamole Bacon Burger. It's exactly what it sounds like - a big ol' slathering of guac and generous slices of bacon atop a fire grilled burger. Warning: It is super messy...but otherwise, ridiculously NOM.  Oh, they also have a pretty sweet "adult" drink selection from beers to mix drinks and sugary delights.  I recommend signing up for their rewards program because you get a free burger meal during the month of your birthday - I just redeemed mine!

The service at this place was excellent!!! The server was very nice and patient. I got the Ensenada chicken platter and it was very good! My friend got a whisky burger and it was out of the world! I will definitely go back.

My husband and i went for dinner one night.  I got the french dip it was ok.  My roll was hard and seemed like it was in the microwave too long.  I noticed they dont have a fryer hence no grease smell but how do they cook the fries?  My husband got the burger with a sunny egg on it.  Apparently the egg is cooked on a hot plate and the burgers are cooking early in the morning.  Im not sure we will be back

Disappointing. The burgers are ok and other items on the menu are not very good. The soups are terrible. It's just seems like they aren't trying.  Additionally, the food usually arrives to the table cold. They advertise  "unlimited fries". But, You get a tiny portion with your dinner and I guess you can ask for more. However, they're nothing special enticing you to want more. We have tried this place 3-4 times as Red Robin is supposed to be a place for awesome burgers. However, We won't be going back. Save some $$ and head down to CheeseBurger Cheeseburger in Oaks for an awesome burger costing less money.

We have visited on a number of occasions and most of the time we order "curbside pickup". When it first opened it was really good. The food was well prepared, hot, and packed well in our to-go containers.  Not so much anymore. We use to eat here every weekend because my son loved  the burgers and grilled cheese. I don't  know what has happened but the service has seriously gone down.  The food is not as well prepared, the customer service is lacking. On two different occasions they gave us the wrong food. We just purchased dinner today after not going for a month and my husband opend his food and his sandwich was completely smashed and looked as if someone opened the sandwich saw it was the wrong order and then they gave it to us instead. Disgusting!

We had seven people and called ahead and they didn't care.  Had a 15% off offer from an email through their rewards program, but they gave me the free burger after 10 burgers that I was entitled to instead - making the 15% offer worthless - the free after 10 is automatic - there was no reason to be enticed to go there with the 15% deal - don't send me these things if I can't use them.  Very disappointed in their new crab cake sandwich - it was a frozen fish failure.  It will be a long time between Red Robin visits for this rewards member - they will be a last resort when we are entertaining kids.

Yeah, and by 'meh' Yelp means, 'NO.'  Pros: Food when my friend was hungry Cons: Service Tiny little booth A margarita without tequila Dirty wine glasses Not good food SERVICE If you pride yourselves on "bottomless fries," wouldn't your server then ask my friend if she wanted more fries? I guess she'd need a personality for that, which was lacking. Service makes or breaks a place. With a great server, this would have been 3-4 stars. But I'll never go back.

Worst experience ever. In a mostly empty restaurant 30 minute wait for our server. 30 more minutes for food to come, food cold & every order wrong. Salads, which were made incorrectly came in dirty bowls, replacements came in dirty bowls again. Other members of the party were done & last corrected burger never came out. Never again. I don't know why this shows the location as Annapolis, MD, it was Collegeville, PA
Burgers all fantastic; service much improved: server came around often, and offered more fries, without requesting!

I stopped by for lunch with my boyfriend this past weekend. We are members of the Red Robin Rewards program and frequent this location. My boyfriend ordered the Chili Cheeseburger and I ordered the Guacamole Bacon burger (no pink). Upon receiving our burgers, I realized that I had been given a plain cheeseburger. A quick look at the Ziosk showed me that our server had ordered me the correct burger. I informed her that the food runner had given me the wrong burger and she apologized and told me she would correct the issue. She returned about 5 minutes later with my new burger, which was still without bacon. When I bit into the burger, it was cooked medium at most (I had ordered well done). She did not check back with us after she returned with the new burger, so even if I had wanted to tell her that my order was still wrong, I did not have the opportunity. BUT here's the real kicker...as I'm sucking it up, eating a burger cooked to a different temperature than I prefer, I discovered a hair in my burger patty. That was it, game over. No more eating that burger for me. I'm a waitress myself. I try to be understanding. But, while the initial mistake was not our waitress' fault, the way that the tiny mistake was handled was horrible. Not checking back to make sure that the issue has been taken care of? I had no one to tell my complaints to.  I will not return.

I got the black pepper bacon burger. Pretty much flavorless. Other than the taste of grease. It left a grease puddle on my plate. Regular fries are large steak fries. Little undercooked and not crispy.  My friend got the turkey burger she said it was ok. Nothing exciting. And sweet potato fries. Again not crispy. And to much salt.  Apps were fried zucchini and clam strips. Both lacked any seasoning. The sauce helped. But just barely.  Ok place. But there is much better around the area.
the food came out and it was very cold. I did not have the experience I expected. I don't know if I would like to come back again.

We have gone here several times and each time was great. Hamburgers were tasty, beer was cold the staff very helpful. We like eating in the bar at the high tables. Less noise without the many children dining with their families.  There is an entrance at the opposite side of Wegman's. It's convenient but you have to go to the front of the restaurant to get on the wait list. With wireless communication available Red Robins should figure out how to support both ends of the restaurant.

Excellent service and the atmosphere is quite lively. Nice room and really freindly staff. They have to be good because the food is simply awful. It's reheated frozen food, which is better in a high school cafeteria. A simple bacon cheeseburger is hard to fail at, but Red Robin did it. French fries were bland and soggy. And the portion is really small The burger "meat" was a grey puck, nothing natural or tasty. The bacon were thin strips of paper that had a bacon flavor.  Good iced tea though, and I liked the tablet on the table for quick payment. I won't be going back. Stick with your local diner, or go to Elevation Burger next door.

A good, solid 2.  Nice wait staff, a tad chilly inside.  The chili itself was good if a little too spicy as in made me cough going down.  The fries were limp and the onion rings tasted of old grease to the point eating the crust alone made me retch.  Good chicken sandwich, daughter loved the mac and cheese, son loved the grilled cheese, other son did not like his cheeseburger...too plastic-y or something.  I got a malt but you wouldn't know it to taste it...may go back for a sandwich but that's it.

Good burger, but not great.  Place is clean and service was ok.  Very casual atmosphere.  I asked for a drink but never got it.  There were three of us and the booth we were given was very cramped, but I did not mind that much, I sat on my coat.  When I feel like a burger, I will probably go back.  The burger is good, but I would not go so far as to call it gourmet. They give you plenty of fries.
Not the employees fault, but this chain employs order takers not professional servers. Corporate should improve training or improve service at the Collegeville location.

My boyfriend and I stopped in to Red Robin for a late lunch today. We were seated right away with a short wait before the waitress came over, explaining that they are under-staffed. The wait for the food was a little long and, when my burger finally arrived, it was wrong. I ended up having to send it back THREE times until it came out as ordered. Well, almost. It was a touch over-cooked...

My sister and I went Saturday night, place was packed so we sat at the bar.  The service was great, the food sucked.  We order 2 beers, and bacon cheddar skins, half the skins had no cheese and no bacon. We ordered 2 burgers both medium well, they both came out Med Rare.  Glad we had a gift card because if I would have spent 44 bucks on that meal i would have been pissed.  Save your money and go to 5 guys or better yet, go support a local business with great burgers.

Love this place. I've been here a few times. I order the DGB every time. It's so good, I'm not  even interested in trying the other stuff on the menu.  Their food is a little more expensive than I would like, but it's always a treat to eat here. I've never had an issue with the service or the food. They always bring out honey mustard when I ask. The cream sodas are awesome. Overall great place to eat. One I will note is that on my last visit, my server didn't tell us we had to pay at the small kiosk on the table. No big deal, my friend and I sat and talked for a little while before we realized, and the kiosk was easy to use. It has a tip calculator built in as well, very useful!

Red Robin has been one of my favorite restaurants to go for years! The burgers are always perfectly delicious and I love the seasoning on the table that I always use on my bottomless fries! My husband and I went for lunch and we had the best service! Hostess was very friendly and seated us right away. Our waitress Victoria could not have been nicer. I will always be a Red Robin fan!

Well done meal for 3 people.  Drink order happened fast, food arrived quickly and was hot. Server was on top of her game.  A refreshing experience at a place that could easily fall prey to burger franchise dysfunction.  Keep up the good work!

I wish I could rate them 5 stars but there is one thing that really bothers me. I order take out from here often on my lunch break because I work nearby. I have been put on hold several times for over ten minutes. After awhile on hold it starts ringing again, someone answers then puts me back on hold. I think my record time of being on hold was 18 minutes and I wish that was an exaggeration but it's not. I still order from here anyways but I do not like being on hold for that long. But they always get my order right and I never experienced any other problems other than the initial ordering

burger is good but i hate their "ziosk" which is a small device for you to pay bills. It never works for me and I have to call my waiter to help. The whole process (paying bills on Ziosk) took me about more than 10 minutes so it is so annoying. Anyway, this location is family friendly and service is good.

Like I said in my check in Great place, Great staff, Good Food only down fall is my order of fries that came with my burger they seemed to car more about presentation than me cause there were 5 fries now I know they are bottomless but by the time the waitress made her rounds "Friday night so busy" and made it back to me I was done my burger and really didn't care about the fries even though I wish I had them 10 mins earlier

Red Robin is ok. The food is definitely overpriced. I will say that the onion rings and homemade chips are great. The burgers are ok, but I find that my burgers tend to be a little undercooked. The service is decent and the establishment is clean. It is great for family dinner.

We checked into Red Robbins for a business lunch. This place offers a lot of burgers and sandwiches of good quality. Nothing exciting but good. We had the gourmet pepper burger and some fish and chips. Will come back for lunch.

Overall good experiences.  We've had GREAT servers and and other times less than great service, but this time we had milkshakes that looked NOTHING like the pictures!...didn't have marshmallows on their s'mores milkshake...lame.
Came in today and the food was great! Left supeeerrr full. My server took awhile to come to the table at first but other then that she was great. Server name was Jessica (:

Ok for what it is. The drinks are overly sweet and seem like there's no alcohol in any of them and the bottomless fries seem soggy and under-seasoned.  The burgers are good when they are done correctly which it seems like 50% of the time I come here it's sent out wrong. I do like Red Robin but I feel there's a lot of room for growth.

5 Star service from Kristina at Red Robin! Delicious short stack of onion rings. Crisp & tasty served with ranch & camp fire sauce. Savory & smoky sauce. Delicious lettuce wrapped burger w avocado , bacon, & red onion. Luscious n juicy!  Pleasant service, fast food delivery & quality!

It's hard to review chain locations like this, since each establishment is designed to be the same. First thing's first - I despise those tablets that you have to order with! They are filthy and inconvenient and I just don't like any place that uses them. This is not my favorite Red Robin location, as it always seems a bit empty. There are a ton of other food places in the shopping center, and RR is kind of hidden on the end, so I am not surprised. Plus with a sports bar and upscale dining restaurant within walking distance, it's to be expected that a chain isn't going to be everyone's first choice. I think if they environment were a bit livelier, I would add an additional start for this location, but I will have to try it again and see how it goes. Food: We sat at the bar and split an order of the "shorty" onion rings, which is a perfect size. I think the regular onion ring tower is definitely means for a larger group!  The entrees came out while we were still working on the appetizer. I got the Gardenburger and my husband got the Red Robin gourmet cheeseburger. Both were cooked well and hot when served.  Drinks: We ordered a 22oz. Blue Moon and a 22.oz Yuengling. The 22 oz. glass was a bit much and I couldn't finish it after the gigantic meal, but it was cold and poured well. I wish they had a cider on draft, as I am not a huge beer drinker for this reason! The bartender(s?) were both nice...we had two of them and it was confusing as to who we should 'report' to....one of them took our drink orders and brought our food out, the other one took the food orders. They weren't super attentive, but we were having date night, so we didn't complain.
Great new waitress in training and good service but very over priced. It's a burger - $14!  Seriously.
My favorite place to go out to eat with my family. Attentive staff, great food, endless fries! Who can resist that?

Updating review, went back to this location a few days later and unfortunately got very sick from cross contamination, I ordered the exact same burger as before so it had to be that. If you're gluten free I would only go on nights that they arent busy... even then you'll still be taking a gamble.
I have mixed feeling about this place when it's good it's very good but when it's bad it truly sucks !  Just wish it would be consistent !

Fancy a burger with all the glory.. Then this is the place for u. Love how many options you have and the bottomless fries and salad, who doesn't want fries with their burgers. Their cheeseburger, crispy chicken and whiskey bbq burgers are excellent paired with sweer potato fries or garlic herbed fries. Did I mention they are bottomless.  The staff is courteous and friendly. Love that you don't have to wait around for your table as they just send u a text message when ready, so you can still shop around rather than hang around.

We are regulars here and recognize that places have off nights but this was ridiculous.  We were promptly seated as soon as we came in.  Jay was our server and he stopped by 4 times telling us he'll be right with us to take our order.  4 times!  We got up and left.   I'm hoping this was just a bad night for them.  We'll be back.

I was meeting my husband for dinner late on a Sunday evening. I asked if we could sit on the EMPTY patio with my 10lb small dog. The hostess asked and was told it wasn't permitted. This is in a shopping center that is VERY family and dog friendly. Other more upscale restaurants in the same complex allow this. You've lost a frequent customer. *Edited to add - we were served across the parking lot without issue at Champps! Better food and atmosphere at the same price point. They were more then welcoming to our dog and even brought him a bowl of ice water! Thanks Champps Collegeville!*

I came in and was greeted immediately. I got 1 beer and a bacon cheeseburger. That's what hurts this review. I got my food, and the burger was way overcooked. People sat next to me 20 minutes later and our food came out at the same time. It's obvious it sat dead in the window. Just over cooked and dried out. It took me another 10-15 minutes to get a knife and some napkins. I ate half of it and just couldn't finish it. Really disappointed in the service and food. I wanted to pay with cash and leave. For the price of everything, I was hoping for better. Hopefully this was a fluke experience
Staff is great and their beers are always cold but i have had stomach issues after eating there twice. Then came to find out others i went with had the same problem.
Good service and good staff. The burger could have been a little more tasty and the pay kiosk at the table never works! So we had to wait 15 mins to pay

Tried ordering online but once I completed adding the items to my cart I find that this location has disabled online ordering...awesome. I call and put my order in getting an order of spinach dip, 3 burgers and steak fries and a wedge salad where I requested the dressing to be on the side.  I let the girl know I had a coupon for 20% off online ordering which I had planned to use but since they had disabled online ordering I can't put the code in and requested to receive the comp. she told me she'd have to talk to the manager but it shouldn't be an issue. I arrive and the girl very graciously comes out to my car in this bitter cold (the only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1) and tells me my price is without the 20% off. I asked her about my 20% off code and she said she forgot and will ask the manager and walks away with my debit card. This is when I go to look at my food and see that my salad has the dressing on it and not on the side as requested. The manager comes out, asks to see my coupon, I show him the code on the website for 20% off online orders and he agrees to take it off.  He also took my salad back to remake with all condiments on the side. I finally get my card back after paying the 20% discounted rate along with my remade salad about 5 minutes later. At this point all of my other food it cold and the fries are soggy by the time I made it 3 miles down the road to my home. The worst part of the experience was the spinach dip. I've posted a picture to show how few chips they gave me.

I visited here on New Year's Day, it was steady business but not an extra long wait time. The waitress was friendly and attentive. I ordered the chicken bruscetta, it was fantastic. I loved the fact that all 5 of us could split the check so easily by using the pay kiosk at the table.
